ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Digest Number 842
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmm Maybe they did lower our agg to mobs.  I used to get the crap beat out of me when I used Dirge.  Up till this I figured the lower taunt everyone was
ygData.messageBody:
Hmm

Maybe they did lower our agg to mobs. I used to get the crap beat out of me
when I used Dirge. Up till this I figured the 'lower taunt' everyone was
debating was just a pigment (I mean figment) of our imaginations. Dirge
used to have a pretty decent taunt factor. If it's taunt factor is gone
then it really is utterly useless now.

Lyrnia
----- Original Message -----
From: "Jeff Illian" <jeff@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, March 27, 2000 9:49 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Digest Number 842


> From: "Jeff Illian" <jeff@...>
>
> > As an example to the (unusually) low taunt of Dirge: we decided to blitz
> the
> > Sol B king room with full spawn, since we had an enchanter with us. I
> told
> > them I'd lead with Dirge as we ran in, which I did. You'd expect that
at
> > least one mob would have rushed me, but all 3 latched onto our warrior
as
> he
> > ran in (ie, he hadn't even taunted or hit anything yet.)
>
> I've been loading this song for kicks when doing Ogre bouncers recently.
> Once an hour, I get to feel like low level nuker :). I've used this song
> maybe 20 times? Not once has a bouncer agro'ed on me.
>
> The other night we had a bad pull of 4 ogres and no enchanter. We had a
> strong party so there was no question of zoning. I took the opporunity to
> see if I could use the song to attract some attention to me to keep the
> Ogres off the cleric. It was the first song I fired up in combat, hit all
4
> for the full damage and not one of them agroed on me... All 4 kept beating
> on our tanks. Heck, the procs on my Kisch or my Ykesha have a ton more
> taunt value then the dirge!
>
> Taneran Dreamweaver
> <Clan Jax>
> Bard of the 45th (almost 46th) song
> Prexus
>
>
>
